body.p:
Headquarters Kentucky Volunteers,
Adjutant=General's Office,
Frankfort, Oct 19th, 1864.
Maj. Genl S. G. Burbridge
Comd'g Dist of Ky
Lexington Ky
General,

On the 4th inst I received letters written by V. P. Allen of Ohio county, and capt Jno. R. Byers of Grayson County addressed to you and by you referred to his Excellency Governor Bramlette complaining of the actions of one Capt. Johnson in taking the lions share of property captured. Immediately upon the receipt of said letters, I made an investigation of the matter, and could find no authority emanating from this Department constituting him an officer of the Militia of Grayson county. I therefore issued Special Order No 67 (copy inclosed) to Col P. G. Reese of the Grayson Militia to take possession of all property captured by Capt Johnson or any other Home or State Guard organization of Grayson Co.
and send an inventory to Brig. Genl S. G. Suddarth, Quarter Master Genl of Ky, who would in return give him full instructions as to its disposition. The same order required Capt Johnson to show his authority for forming an Independent company. Col Reese has forwarded to me copies of said authority, a copy of which I inclose herein, as well as an order directing disposition to be made of captured property. I have endeavored, and I think have quite successfully restrained acts of lawlessness on the part of our State Guards, I therefore respectfully remonstrate against the appointing of captains of Indept companies by Genl Ewing, and especially vesting them with such plenary power as given to Johnson. It will be impossible to restrain men from acts of violence and disregard of all law, whose services are to be rewarded by the plunder captured. I therefore ernestly request that you will render us your assistance in restraining these irregular issues of authority --

Very Respectfully
Your Obdt Servt
(Signed) D. W. Lindsey
Insp. & Adj. Genl Ky-

A true copy
Jno B. Tilford Jr
Asst Adjt Genl
